modules.description: Formats OCaml source code according to specified rules, adjusting indentation, spacing, and layout. Works with abstract syntax trees and source code strings to apply consistent formatting. Used to standardize code style in projects, especially when integrating with CI pipelines or enforcing team-wide conventions.

Provides functions to parse and validate configuration files, generate formatting rules, and execute formatting actions on source files or standard input. Operates on file paths, configuration records, and command-line input structures. Formats OCaml source files according to specified rules, checks for existing formatting, and modifies files in place.
